name: ushgrunop
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0

stmt.origin: uhgrunop(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, w0)
stmt.pretty: uhgrunop(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, w0)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(cop(c0, cun(c1, c2)), cuhgr))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cuhgr))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cuhgr))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(ciedg, c3))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(ciedg, c4))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(cvtx, c3))
-| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cvtx, c4), c0))
-| wi(w0, wceq(cin(cdm(c1), cdm(c2)), emptycls))
body.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → < c0,(c1 ⋃ c2)> ∈ UHGraph)
⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ UHGraph)
⊣ (w0 → c4 ∈ UHGraph)
⊣ c1 =(iEdg ` c3)
⊣ c2 =(iEdg ` c4)
⊣ c0 =(Vtx ` c3)
⊣ (w0 →(Vtx ` c4)= c0)
⊣ (w0 →(dom(c1)⋂ dom(c2))= ∅)

-| wi(w0, wceq(cin(cdm(c1), cdm(c2)), emptycls))

⊣ c2 =(iEdg ` c4)
⊣ c0 =(Vtx ` c3)
⊣ (w0 →(Vtx ` c4)= c0)
⊣ (w0 →(dom(c1)⋂ dom(c2))= ∅)

|- wi(w0, wcel(c3, cuhgr))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cushgr))
-| wi(wcel(c3, cushgr), wcel(c3, cuhgr))

comment: The union of two (undirected) simple hypergraphs (with the same vertex set) represented as ordered pair: If ` <. V , E >. ` and ` <. V , F >. ` are simple hypergraphs, then ` <. V , E u. F >. ` is a (not necessarily simple) hypergraph - the vertex set stays the same, but the edges from both graphs are kept, possibly resulting in two edges between two vertices. (Contributed by AV, 29-Nov-2020.) (Revised by AV, 24-Oct-2021.)
